intro: Paronychia arabica subsp. lenticulata, commonly known as the lenticular paronychia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is native to southern Africa. This subspecies is noted for its compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover in arid landscapes.
